reviews.review: This game is a classic and after all these years this masterful piece of game still rocks and it is really nice to come back and have some nostalgia once in a while

Haven't smiled like this in a long while and I think I'm old enough to have forgotten childish giggles until I played this. Not played anything like it. High replay value I would suspect like the Half-Life game, to get faster and better in each level. Short, but I played this slowly over time, whilst enjoying the beauty in the visual graphic and laughter through the dialogue. Never knew the writing was so well done, surprising. 
Uplifting and the humour once again I have not seen before also fitting right into a completely new world I enjoyed exploring. Worthy of purchase on sales or whatever. So happy I played this. This game will produce great memories while using mechanics not seen in other games with interactivity being  a key part of the game. 10/10 Can't wait to get into Portal 2. 
Yes for how short it is it has all of the story it needs and then some as well.

[h1]Recensione di Portal[/h1]

[b]PRO:[/b]
+ Narrativa semplice ma intrigante.
+ Puzzle ed enigmi ben strutturati.
+ La meccanica dei portali è molto originale.
+ Dialoghi divertenti e spassosi.
+ Buon livello di sfida.
+ Le Camere Avanzate e le Sfide sono un buon extra a fine gioco.

[b]CONTRO:[/b]
- Dura veramente poco.

[b]VOTO:[/b] [h1]9/10[/h1]

In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#131 out of 555)... it's time for Portal.

Seems kinda pointless to review Valve games on Steam, but oh well, here we are. Portal's central portal mechanic is really compelling and makes for some truly mind-bending puzzles, and the narrative framing, such as it is, is typically very amusing. That said, you'll be spending most of your time in very similar looking, small environments, which can be a bit claustrophobic, and flying through portals can often be disorienting (especially when inertia comes into play). I was also unable to find an FOV setting that didn't make me nauseous after a few minutes of play. So if you tend to be succeptible to motion sickness, you might want to give this one a pass. Otherwise, as I'm sure y'all already know, Portal is one of the most innovative puzzle games of all time and a fantastic example of the kind of puzzles that are only possible with digital interactive media.

Siga a minha página de curador da Steam, Honest Opinion: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38350841/

Um dos melhores jogos puzzles que há, e definitivamente um dos mais conhecidos também, Portal é um jogo fenomenal. Com desafios de lógica muito bons e grau de dificuldade crescente ao decorrer do jogo, ele não chega a patamares impossíveis.

Além dos desafios de lógica, temos uma história no jogo em si. Basicamente, estamos presos em um local que testa novas tecnologias em humanos, a Aperture. Com isso, temos a GLaDOS, uma forma de inteligência artificial, controlando todo o local e nos direcionando para os locais (além de nos dizer como outras pessoas fracassaram as fases e etc.).

Com certeza é um jogo legal de se jogar mais vezes, até pelo fato de ser difícil decorar as soluções de todos os puzzles e conseguir passar direto na próxima jogatina.

Para fãs de jogos puzzle, este jogo é obrigatório de se ter basicamente. Para quem não é muito fã de puzzles, este jogo pode ser uma boa tentativa também de qualquer maneira, por conta de sua história e de seus puzzles não serem absurdamente difíceis, diferentemente de alguns jogos puzzles.

okay I've put a frankly ridiculous amount of time into this game, because it's just that good. Portal, while short, is such an enjoyable gameplay experience. It's 2020 now, nearly 13 years after the game's initial release date, and it really still manages to hold up. I'm not saying much more than that because really, who hasn't played this? and if you're one of the .002% of people who haven't played it... what are you waiting for??! it's great for avid gamers and new gamers alike, and continues to be one of my favorites.
it was fun a good challenge and story
Me gustó mucho este juego. La mecánica de los portales es muy novedosa y obliga a pensar de manera diferente.

While the main game is short, Portal doesn't only finish with one of the best credits songs ever created. After the story is done new challenge levels are unlocked. These extras are six levels that you've already played. The difference is that they have new challenges associated with them.

Levels demand a mixture of skills, all of which make use of portals in some way and your new tool when you acquire it. Most exciting are the sections that rely on momentum, which is conserved as you travel through portals. Place an entrance at ground level and an exit high up on a wall and step through the lower portal, either by simply dropping into it or falling from a height. You can use this to almost fly across some levels. Instead of letting yourself hit the ground, you can shoot a portal under your feet to catch you and continue through the air from wherever your last portal was left. 

Valve has created a masterpiece, honestly. If you like puzzle games with a story and rememberable characters, the portal games are for you. It's worth the standard price, without a question, but if money is tight, it can be picked up cheap in other stores or on sale. Honestly, if puzzle games aren't your norm, I still recommend it for it's story.

Spoiler Free Review

Pros: 
- Gameplay is fun, innovative, and unique, allowing for puzzles and experimentation that hasn't really been done in any other video game before or since. Thinking with Portals is always fun and solving the puzzles of the test chambers are always satisfying, especially when you manage to do something you previously thought wasn't going to work. Unlike a lot of other puzzle games, Portal rewards and expects outside the box thinking.
- Wonderful Story and Setting. I love the vaguely creepy and minimalist look of the game and also adore how it fits so well with the gameplay. This in combination with the fantastic writing and voice acting compliments stellar gameplay design.
- Amazing Soundtrack: Has some of the best music in video game history despite only really having a handful of songs throughout the whole game. The ending song will always and forever evoke fond memories of this game for me.
- After completing the main story mode, there is still plenty to do if you haven't had your fill of portal puzzles. Extra goodies include a commentary mode that let's you learn more about the making of the game, extra challenge modes, and even easter eggs and special achievements.
Cons: 
- That there isn't more. Luckily there is Portal 2
- Being a puzzle game, there unfortunately isn't much to replaying the game outside of speedruns and trips down memory lane. While the quality of the game can still be enjoyed even after knowing how to get through the game, it still isn't the same as trying to make your way through the puzzles for the first time. However this is more a flaw in the puzzle game genre itself rather than Portal as a game.
Conclusion: 
Objectively not only one of the best video games made by Valve, but one of the best in the FPS and Puzzle genres. This game still can hold its own against modern day titles and deserves its spot both as one of the best video games of all time, but also as a bitter-sweet reminder of Valve's glory days. As of writing this review, only time will tell if Valve will ever make a full return to developing games, but even if that never happens we will still have this masterpiece.

I never understood replayability until I played portal. I have beaten this games tightly knit story dozens of times, not to speedrun, unlock all the achievements or anything like that: it's solely the overwhelming sense of fun and emotional connection I have with this game, and I keep coming back. An absolute classic and an absolute steal definitely worth the cheekiest of buys ;)
